Sistema de dados estruturados. Metodologia de pesquisa de percepção de segurança definida e pelo menos um piloto realizado. Pesquisas e estudos sobre: prevenção, guarda municipal, fronteira, condições psicológicas dos policiais, pericia criminal Cursos de Convivência e Segurança Cidadã realizados.

comment.narrative: Ausência de uma política nacional de segurança pública; ausência de um sistema de dados e informações integrado e fidedigno; fragilidade na política de prevenção e na produção de subsídios e diretrizes para as diversas áres envolvidas diretamente com a segurança pública.
Elaboração de metodologias para produção de subsídios para as discussões da 2a Conferência Nacional de Segurança Pública.

Entre 2011 e 2016, foram realizadas 5 edições do Edital Pensando a Segurança, através de parceria com 67 universidades públicas e privadas, em temas prioritários para a SENASP. Como a Conferência Nacional de Segurança Pública não ocorreu, a elaboração de subsídios para as discussões que seriam realizadas nela não foi realizada. Foi realizada, no entanto, a Edição Especial de Pesquisas Pensando o Direito - Edição CONSEG.

comment.narrative: O Projeto Brasil 3 Tempos baseou-se em problemas observados no Brasil relacionados aos valores éticos e morais da civilização ocidental, envolvendo a miscigenação racial, multiculturalismo, liberdade religiosa, riqueza e pobreza, público e privado; e, na competição interna existente no Sistema Industrial Latino-Americano, envolvendo as complementaridades e oportunidades do mercado nacional brasileiro frente aos mercados latino-americanos.

Em virtude da reforma ministerial levada a cabo pelo governo no final de 2015, no bojo da qual as atribuições da Secretaria de Assuntos Estratégicos da Presidência da República foram repassadas ao Ministério do Planejamento, Orçamento e Gestão - MPOG, por meio do Decreto Presidencial nº 8.578, de 26 de novembro de 2015, se fez necessária uma nova revisão substantiva, apenas para ajustar a titularidade do Projeto que passa então a ser do MPOG. Dessa forma, a a Revisão Substantiva tem como objetivo ajustar os arranjos de gestão do Documento de Projeto à nova realidade advinda a partir da entrada em vigor do Decreto 8.578, indicando como nova Agência Executora Nacional do Projeto o Ministério do Planejamento, Orçamento e Gestão – MPOG.
Revisão Substantiva aprovada e assinada. Iniciadas as discussões com equipe do MP acerca das ações a serem implementadas no escopo do Projeto.
Apoiar ações de capacitação do IBGE na construção de indicadores para os ODS; Emitir nova Revisão substantiva do Projeto transferindo novamente a titularidade do Projeto para a SAE.

Implementação baixa, quase nula do Projeto. Aprovada revisão substantiva do Projeto transferindo a titularidade para a SAE e incluindo o IPC-IG como Agência Implementadora do Projeto. Definição do Plano de Trabalho a ser implementado com o IPC-IG, incluindo 6 estudos.

The project elaborated the Programme for Monitoring of Biodiversity in Federal UCs with Mangroves it takes into consideration exploited and nonexploited species of fauna and flora in mangroves areas and presents a cluster of Rapid Assessment Protocols RAPs for prioritized species according to Secretariat of the Convention of Biological Diversity 2006 and Secretariat of Ramsar Convention 2005 2010 The selected species include the Eudocimus ruber commonly denominated Guará nonexploited and the Ucides cordatus commonly denominated Uçá Crab exploited that are mentioned in the project as indicators for conservation of biodiversity of mangroves areas
The project elaborated ToRs and started actions for data gathering and metaanalysis findings will be available by the end of 2015 two specialized services have been purchased
U cordatus is one of the most investigated species in Conservation Units of Brazil CUs preliminary indicative data on stock estimation can be obtained in applied researches in the Cassurubá CU Schmidt 2008 2010 and 2012 and in APA CIP Pinheiro 2013 U Cordatus also allows to make substantial and scientificbased inferences on climate change as it it sensitive to environmental alterations eg rains temperatures
E ruber is relevant as nests are only in mangrove woods hence the nest monitoring allows to indicate effects on environmental alterations eg mangrove health pollution Some data are available in CEMAVEICMBio National Center for Research and Conservation of Wild Birds specifically for Cururupú CU Resex in Maranhão state Mamanguape River CUs APA and ARIE in Paraiba State and in CananeiaIguapePeruibe CU APA in Sao Paulo
Furthermore the project started several activities in order to develop and fully implement the participatory monitoring of biodiversity eg SocMon methodology focused on socialenvironmental indicators and to harmonize those tools and protocols through an appropriation process within the ICMBio ie ongoing consultancy leaded by the competent department COMOBDIBIOICMBio in order to guarantee sustainability and ownership of outputs see outcome 4

description.narrative: 2 Vegetation cover of mangroves in project intervention Ucs

comment.narrative: 568000 hectares
At least the same as at project start

Data on extension of cover vegetation of mangroves in Brazil and in Pilot Areas are under elaboration CSRIBAMA hired two professionals for the elaboration of final maps on mangroves in Brazil they are validating field data and updating the 2013 mangroves map Final output is expected by August 2015 During the present reporting time the project supported staff of the CSRIBAMA with inthefield missions to mangroves areas in order to check and validate some uncertain limits of the 2013 satellite map The ongoing final phase includes
Final map of mangroves area in Brazil
Mangroves geographic maps states municipalities CUs and thematic maps shrimp culture metaanalysis using some relevant maps available at the Brazilian Institute For Geography and Statistics IBGE and at the Institute for Applied Economic Research IPEA such as HDI demography income cash transfer programmes such as Bolsa Familia
Comparison with 2010 map of mangroves in Brazil and evaluation of trends
Identification of salt flats and marshes apicuns This last parameter is critical for policy incidence and advocacy Salt flats are part of mangrove ecosystem and they are critical for transition renovation and expansion of mangroves and the for health and resilience of the ecosystem However they are slightly recognized in Brazilian legal framework Resolution 3032012 CONAMA and are commonly exploited for shrimp culture and salt mines This situation tends to deteriorate as salt flats are threatened by the agribusiness sector interpretation of the Law 126512012 also called New Forest Code which stipulates the possibility of increasing shrimp and salt production in those areas 10 in Amazon biome and 35 in other biomes An estimation of such expansion is not available yet as it is the first apicuns mapping exercise

There is an error in the text of the indicator The PRI format reports the text of the indicator 1 The right text is of mangrove ecosystems in mangrove UCs under management categories or other legal instruments that allow sustainable use SU andor limit any use and targets strict conservation SC Examples of legal instruments for SU other than management categories is in the take zones
The project adopted in its elaboration the physicalenvironmental criteria discussed by the World Bank and the WWF in order to identify ecoregions with mangroves Seven ecoregions were identified in Brazil
UNIT I from Mouth of Rio Oiapoque to Mouth of Rio Araguari AP
UNIT II from Mouth of Rio Araguari AP to Colares PA
UNIT III from Colares PA to Parnaíba Delta MAPI
UNIT IV From Parnaíba Delta MAPI to Rio Guajú RNPB
UNIT V Form Rio Guajú RNPB to BAES boundary
UNIT VI from BAES boundary to Cabo Frio RJ
UNIT VII from Cabo Frio RJ to Barra do Sul SC
When the project was elaborated 20042005 there where 132 CUs 89 CUs belonged to the Sustainable Use categories and 43 to the strict conservation ones Nowadays there are 162 CUs 94 in SU category 58 and 68 in SC category 42
Unit CUs SU SC
I 3 0 100

It should be noticed that the project prompts and supports the creation and enlargement of several CUs of the SU category ie RESEX extractive reserves in Amazon coastal area of Pará en Maranhão states During the reporting period the project supported the creation if three RESEX and the enlargement of one in Pará October 2014 and is involved in the creation of other five RESEX and the enlargement of one in Pará and Maranhão More details in indicator 1 of the outcome 2
Finally we mention that the present indicator takes into consideration the categories of the CUs as a whole However within each SU conservation unit the project supports the elaboration of official management tools such as the Management Agreements in Salgado Paraense and te Management Plans in APA CIP and Mamanguape Those tools establish the zoning of the CUs and the allowed use of each zone thus SC percentage is higher than reported due to the fact that parts of SU units are notake zones logically assimilated to strict conservation areas

As mentioned in PIR 2014 there is an ongoing debate within the ICMBio on most adequate tools and processes for monitoring and evaluation of effectiveness of CUs and their performance in conserving biodiversity Inprogress processes are
Harmonization between METT and RAPPAM the official tool of the Ministry of Environment The purpose of the project is to use a tool whose valuesresults can be monitored in the future and compared
Development of an ICMBio system for ME of effectiveness of CUs and management support to CUs managers in planning and decision making leaded by the Directorate for Creation and Management of CUs DIMANCGCAP
In any case the METT will be applied as planned and it will be completed with inputs form other sources eg RAPPAM ongoing study on financial sustainability of CUs with mangroves in the frame of output 13 outcome 1 So far according to 2012 METT applied in the frame of the MTR poor 8 fair 58 good 38 excellent 0 However it must be mentioned that some criteria of the METT format applied in in 2012 are different from those used in 2007 finalscore changed thus the comparison with baseline METT is not linear

description.narrative: 5 of other pilot PAs testing 1 or more of financing strategies developed in the project

comment.narrative:
The study on financial sustainability of CUs with mangroves is under elaboration The Brazilian Fund for Biodiversity FUNBIO is the partner for the elaboration of the study in alliance with sectorspecialized NGOs Study includes training for CUs managers and civil servants and recommendations of specific financial tools in specific areas It must be mentioned that FUNBIO is an implementing partner of the GEF MAR project also executed by the ICMBio a similar activity is expected in GEF MAR on financial sustainability of marine and coastal CUs The project stimulated the dialogue and articulated with GEF MAR staff the ongoing study represent phase 1 elaboration of strategy definition of good practices recommendations training advocacy at federal level and it will be continued within the GEF MAR implementation advocacy and incidence institutionalization
On the other hand during the reporting period the project supports the Mosaic Lagamar in the negotiation of financial support though parliamentary amendments at state and municipal level in order to capture a percentage of environmental compensations generated by the CUs that are part of the mosaic the payment of environmental services and ICMSE among others It is a recommendation of the Diagnostic on Normative Framework in Mangroves Areas elaborated by the project in 2012 The project staff considers it as a concrete initiative on financial sustainability and the evaluation of the experience will feed the ongoing study

1 of water management instruments agreed upon by the Mamanguape waterbasin committee that take into
account the water quantity and quality for mangroves

comment.narrative: 0 of 6

So far two management instruments were defined a the activation of the Technical Chamber for Water Resources within the Management Council of the Barra do Rio Mamanguape APA and AIRE b a monitoring protocol on water quality
The two management tools have been defined and approved by the APA and ARIE councils Eventually a diagnostic of water resources is under implementation through an external consultancy it is a a baseline for the monitoring protocol b a database and diagnostic for the elaboration of proposals and programmes by the Chamber The Chamber will develop and promote research data sharing mechanisms and mitigation actions
It must be noticed that
1 There is not a unique waterbasin committee the two water basin committees Upper and Lower participate of the Chamber
2 SUDEMA authority for environment in the state of Parnaiba already monitors some parameters The defined protocol complements those parameters and communicate with SUDEMA database The Aquatic Mammals Foundation FMA also shared relevant data on flora and fauna The two stakeholders participate to the councils and to the Chamber
3 The monitoring protocol will be applied by students of the Federal University of Parnaiba The university participates to the council and to the chamber the inthefield work of the students is in the frame of the Interinstitutional Collaboration Agreement between the APA and the university it is costless for the ICMBio and it will be applied during next years continuity technical and financial sustainability
4 Private sector representatives participate to the councils and to the chamber Most relevant are the association of shrimp producers and the union of sugar cane and alcohol producers Indigenous communities are also represented communitarian leaders along with FUNAI National Fund for Indigenous People
The project expect the approval of at least one more management tolls The Chamber is discussing the elaboration of technical proposals with the aim to turn them into management instruments for water resources a Action Plan with contingency measures based on agreed alarmlevel monitored indicators Terms for Conduct Adjustments TCA new interinstitutional collaboration agreements

description.narrative:
2 Degree that mangrove conservation is incorporated in Zoning of the Reentríncias Maranhenses APA

comment.narrative:
Initial zoning for agroecological activities shrimp farming and indicators starting for deforestation but reflected in PAplanning and management
1 municipality in the APA has a development plan that considers mangrove needs zoning
0 of the key actors in APA have signed a formal document of adherence to zoning regulations

UC management plan reflects zoning and limits of all main economic activities
16 municipalities 200000 ha in the APA have agreed on the zoning
50 of the key actors in the APA sign formal document of adherence to zoning regulations

Two main outputs contribute to the outcome and this specific indicator
1 The APA CIP management Plan So far 42 meetingsworkshops have been done involving almost 700 people Six municipalities have part of their territories inside the APA CIP limits representatives participate to workshops and to the elaboration process
Mangrove conservation has been included in Management Plan as a crosscutting issue in all thematic and geographic components of the Plan and a specific zone has been created Mangrove Conservation Zone Three geographic sectors have been identified Thematic clusters have been defined traditional communities water resources urban expansion climate changes fishery and aquaculture agriculture and farming tourism nonfishery natural resources
Zoning was concluded and it will be presented between the 25 of June and the 15 of July along with specific regulations and restrictions for each sector Specific mangrove protection area have been mapped and included in the Plan The Plan is elaborated with a broad participation of social stakeholders indigenous and traditional communities organized civil society eg universities NGOs and foundations public authorities at municipal state and federal level So far municipalities participates to the process
2 The Action Plan of the Lagamar Mosaic was elaborated and it is now under revision and validation The project promoted and supported the creation of the management mechanism in the Mosaic The Mosaic is composed by 54 CUs with different jurisdictions The project supported the Mosaic in the elaboration of a single cartographic and bibliographic database along with the Atlantic Forest and Climate Changes Project of the Ministry of Environment supported by the German Cooperation GIZ and KfW with which the project maintains synergies

1 Awareness and dissemination campaigns have been organized and executed especially in the frame of the Protagonist Youth initiative that already mobilized more than 500 people at community level in Pará state 30 of which are women
2 Communication over ecosystem services will be realized as part of the dissemination and knowledge sharing of the outcomes of the FUNBIO ongoing study on financial sustainability of CUs with mangroves
3 The international seminar for the participatory monitoring of biodiversity was a relevant forum where the project participated and communicated mangrove status and project outputs and outcomes It was realized in September 2014 in Manaus with the participation of more than 250 people
4 The project along with the Coordination for Production ICMBioDISATCOPROD is executing the last phase of a systematization process started in 2014 focused on successful experiences of economic social and cultural inclusion in Sustainable Use marine and coastal CUs Nine experiences were systematized the project is now finalizing las inthefield missions validating the information editing the texts
5 A video was realized by the Coordination for Environmental Education ICMBioDISATCOEDU with the participation of the project Extrativist Citizens which means people of the RESEXs
6 Massive communication campaign was realized during last months of 2014 articles on blogs national and stat newspapers and magazines interviews in national and local televisions We enjoyed a positive visibility conjuncture thanks to the creation of three new RESEX with mangroves in the Para State that constitute the largest continuous protected mangrove area in the world The issue was also published in the official blog of the President Dilma Roussef more data in Communication section

description.narrative: 3 Development and marketing of new Mangrove products

comment.narrative:
At present most local communities and populations lack the capacity to produce and market potential new products from mangrove areas
18 families involved in sustainable economic alternatives to uíá capture

100 potential local small entrepreneurs trained in the preparation of a business plan
100 families in the pilot UCs involved in sustainable alternatives including women and youth

According to Substantial Revision January 2014 the focus of the project moved from market access of mangroves products to market promotion and income generation through land planning and management tools Management agreements in Salgado Paraense pilot area and the Crab Management Plan in Delta do Parnaiba pilot area are the most relevant actions of the project in order to achieve the outcome Several data show that developed technologies and tolls eg the normative on crab transportation zoning and stock monitoring had relevant impact on income of vulnerable and poor coastal communities eg average weekly revenues for fishery activities at household level for families that adopted the crab transportation technology rise from R 1304 to R 1982 representing 24 increment

The project supports the development of the management agreements for 9 RESEX in Pará state The outcomes of this process will support the elaboration of guidelines for management agreements at national level specifically for CUs of sustainable use
Management plans guidelines
Considering that CUs with mangroves are mostly in a category for sustainable use the project prioritizes guidelines for RESEX Extractive Reserve and APA Environmental Protection Area
Management Plan of the APA CIP the zoning considers the several existing instruments such as Municipal Plans for Environments Directors Plan Management Plans of other Conservation Units inside the APA Ecological Economic Zoning of the States for São Paulo and Paraná among others
Participation to the deliberative consultative councils and to the Technical Committees of the Conservation Units in pilot areas Thematic calendars have been defined for each council eg urban expansion climatic change zoning traditional communities as well as working groups in order to better perform the duties of the councils
Elaboration and diffusion of the Guidelines for Managers and Counselors of the Councils of Federal Conservation Unites elaborated by the CGSAMDISAT
Financing mechanisms
Study on financial mechanism in CUs with mangroves in order to elaborate a national strategy The execution of the diagnostic and strategy is responsibility of FUNBIO The project already linked this action to the GEF MAR project implementationtest training activities and a continuum strategy on financial sustainability in coastal and marine CUs will be maintained in the GEF MAR
Mosaic Lagamar APA CIP Pilot Area in the negotiation of the financial support though parliamentary amendments at state and municipal level in order to capture a percentage of environmental compensations generated by the CUs that are part of the mosaic

A Technical Chamber for Water Resources has been activated within the Management Council of the Mamanguape APA and AIRE The project is developing the diagnosis of water resources and a monitoring protocol on water quality The Chamber will develop and promote research data sharing mechanisms and mitigation actions through competent bodies
The management plan for the APA CIP pilot area is proposing programmes and regulations on water resources quality with emphasis on the mangroves conservation

comment.narrative: 1. Limited capacity in term of EE offer from local market players. 2. Limited capacity of EE product and service providers. 3. No tender process for public buildings.

1. EE market capacity building strategy in place. 2. Up to 1,400 EE product/service providers trained (ESCOs, equipment providers, building owners/ managers/associations, engineering associaciations, education institutions, universities, etc) by the end of the project. 3. As per substantive revision signed by the end of 2015, 20 public buildings technically assisted and 10 bids of EE projects in the public sector due to the project, by the end of the project.

1. The project is strengthening the Building Labelling Program of Brazil by launching a second phase of trainings on a national level: 26 trainings aimed at 900 professionals. There were developed 6 didatic videos about PBE Edifica, 1 about Projeteee and another 1 related to solar heating systems which have more than 8,480 views on the Ministry channel on youtube since March 2016 and achieved more than 53,000 people and 8,600 visualizations by UNDP' social media publications. A series of events and trainings were performed reaching 734 agents from public and private sectors on themes related to EE in building and achieving more than 915 regarding EE and renewable (solar PV) financing. Regarding project's publications, more than 4200 agents were achieved by the 3 guides elaborated by the project. 2.Total of 1,930 professionals from public and private sector reached by trainings in the last period. Seven (7) technical workshops implemented in relevant National congresses and events reaching 535 agents from public and private sectors. Five (5) participation in events to disseminate results and products developed reaching 280 professionals. 5 Training events (3x4hs + 2x20hs) related to PBE Edifica, reaching 200 people in national level. Dissemination of financing solutions and EEGM to more than 915 agents in twelve (12) sector events nationally. 3. The benchmarking selected 20 buildings based on technical features and its regional representativity to receive: energy audits, smart meterings and assistance to obtain financing. After the technical assessments the beneficiaries of the benchmarking will be supported to design projects for applying to resources of ANEEL's EE Program.

1. EE market capacity building strategy in place. 2. Up to 1,400 EE product/service providers trained (ESCOs, equipment providers, building owners/ managers/associations, engineering associaciations, education institutions, universities, etc) by the end of the project. 3. 20 public buildings technically assisted and 10 bids of EE projects in the public sector due to the project, by the end of the project.

1. EE market capacity building strategy has been put in place. The project has continued to strengthen PBE Edifica labelling programme by concluding a second phase of trainings reaching 760 professionals, having its efforts been commended by Tribunal de Contas da União, Brazil´s highest public accountability authority. The 8 videos prepared by the project, and available in the Ministry of Environment´s Youtube channel, have continued to garner views, with an accumulated total of 27,100 views. Information regarding the project has also been disseminated through the Ministry´s and UNDP Brazil Facebook pages, where the posts received a total of 1,363 likes, as well as were shared 702 times and visualized by nearly 11,000 people. Trainings on how to use smart metering systems for energy management aimed at the managers and technicians from the buildings participating in the benchmark developed were held in Brasília and São Paulo. A further two training courses to be held also in Brasília and São Paulo on how to use the benchmark of energy consumption in public office buildings and the web-tool developed in connection thereof, aimed at public and private sector professionals will take place.
2. Over the years the project has trained nearly 2,200 EE product/service providers. In 2016 the project started to offer training to professionals from the public and private sectors on measuring and evaluation methodologies pursuant to the rules of ANEEL´s EE programme and the Efficiency Valuation Organization (EVO)´s International Performance Measurement and Verification Protocol (IPMVP). Participating professionals were selected nationally by means of a competitive selection process. Six training courses addressing ANEEL´s EE programme methodology have been held in São Paulo/SP, Brasília/DF, Rio de Janeiro/RJ, Porto Alegre/RS, Florianópolis/SC and Salvador/BA, reaching over 140 professionals, with a further two trainings aimed at 50 professionals to be held in July in Campo G

A Centre for Indigenous training exists in the Amazon CAFI and in 2006 trained 15 IPs in environmental management but this does not include standards and practices for ethnozoning for BD conservation Other regions do not have Centres or trained IPs

All IO of the 5 regional networks have strengthened capacities for environmental management and to execute monitor IL National Plans projects
20 IP in each of the biomes have skill required for ethnoenvironmental management

The itinerant training program Mosarambihara Seeders for the GuaraniKaiowá of 3 reference areas in Mato Grosso do Sul held its first course module in December 2014 The indigenous organization ASCURI has been hired by means of a Letter of Agreement to carry out the remaining modules and register the course in video
The proposed course in Agroecology for the Terena with the Universidade Estadual do Mato Grosso do Sul UEMS Glória de Dourados campus has been shifted from a techical degree to a full undergraduate degree University personnel and indigenous representatives will meet with the Ministry of Education in Brasília on July 1 2015 for further discussion as to funding mechanisms for this proposal

description.narrative: Mechanisms and tools have been developed that enable Brazils ILs to be recognized and strengthened as effective areas for conserving forest biodiversity natural resources and the environmental services
5Existence of recognized environmental management standards and targets in Indigenous Lands

comment.narrative:
A National Protected Areas Plan PNAP exists to guide the establishment of a comprehensive system of protected areas including contributions from ILs s but no specific targets standards or practices for these are defined
In Sept 2008 a working group GTI was established to elaborate a proposal of National Policy for Environmental Management in IL

A National Conservation Plan for Indigenous Lands that contains targets for conservation of representative forest ecosystems through environmental management exists and is harmonized and integrated with the NPAP and adapted to the environmental and social needs of ILs
this Plan would be aligned with and form part of a National Policy on Environmental Management of IL PNGATI

The PNGATI Steering Committee installed on Oct 30 2013 has since met several times During the 2nd CG PNGATI Ordinary Meeting on 0325 262014 two Technical Councils were created one to organize the PNGATI National Conference and the other to create the Integrated Plan for PNGATI implementation PIIPNGATI The latter promoted a workshop on 1120 212014 to create a logical framework for implementation of the Policy This framework will be used by the different ministries to orient the federal governments Pluriannual Plan for 20162019 currently being constructed by the Ministry of Planning and Budget And during the 4th Ordinary Meeting 120221032014 the CG PNGATI discussed the planning framework proposal and defined a timeline for ordinary meetings in 2015

description.narrative: Sector and regional vulnerabilities to climate change have been assessed using improved methodologies and climate models
A Status of Brazilian Global Model of the Climate System MBSCG

comment.narrative: A SNC no Brazilian Global model only EtaCPTEC regional model
A MBSCG developed and EtaCPTEC model improved with higher resolution for a larger domain

The Global Model of the Climate System MBSCG and the EtaCPTEC regional model were improved with higher resolution for a larger domain The coupled oceanatmosphere version of the Brazilian Earth System Model BESM former MBSCG was implemented and tested in the supercomputer Tupa installed at INPE This version of BESM is able to generate scenarios of global climate change for present time up to 2100
However a preliminary analysis identified the need for improvements in some used models Now it is necessary to investigate these gaps and needs more accurately a process that will now rely on the recent entry of Brazil in the Earth System Grid Federation ESGF through INPE
In order to enhance the countrys data assessment and management capacities which are critical to facilitate BESMs developing process after a comprehensive survey INPE proposed that the Ministry of Science Technology and Innovation of Brazil MCTI financed the Institutes insertion in the Earth System Grid Federation ESGF a ultrascale data network that provides stateoftheart online communication for the exchange of information among specialists that are contributing to BESMs completion
Thus along with the acquisition of the equipment and software required to make Brazil one of the ESGF world nods a specialist was hired to design and present workshops aimed at training INPE and other institutions researchers and public managers in this new tool Currently INPE resarchers are already using the ESGFINPE platform and the second workshop is being planned by the consultant and the TCNs Coordination team

Relatório de progresso final do projeto elaborado.
Relatório de progresso final do projeto elaborado.

Em novembro de 2016, na última revisão substantiva, foi autorizada a prorrogação do prazo de vigência do referido projeto até 30 de setembro de 2017, com o objetivo de ensejar a conclusão de suas atividades previstas. À época, ficou definida a contratação de algumas consultorias para a atualização e recalculo das séries históricas dos indicadores do Sistema Nacional de Informações em Direitos Humanos – SNIDH.

Contudo, o cenário de mudanças estruturais e políticas em que se encontra a Agência Executora, bem como o atraso na estruturação do novo Ministério dos Direitos Humanos - MDH, acarretaram demora do cumprimento das ações previstas. Não houve execução.

ACTIVITY1: % de proteção dos biomas brasileiros; nº de mecanismos e instrumentos concebidos para subsidiar a implementação e gestão de áreas protegidas; nº de instituições de todos os setores engajados em ações/iniciativas visando à implementação das decisões da CDB; nº de ferramentas de gestão sobre a diversidade aquática e recursos pesqueiros.
ACTIVITY2: nº de mecanismos e instrumentos concebidos.
ACTIVITY3: nº de consultas regionais e nacionais e diretrizes nacionais; nº de diagnóstico baseado na compilação dos estudos técnicos realizados para caracterização de regiões importantes para a conservação das zonas úmidas brasileiras; nº de indicações de criação de novas UCs e Sítios RAMSAR; nº de avaliação de oficinas de capacitação dos gestores; nº de campanhas educativas de disseminação da importância da conservação das zonas úmidas.
ACTIVITY4: nº de estudos e diagnósticos realizados; nº de oficinas de trabalho e consultas realizadas.
ACTIVITY5: nº de sistemas de informação sobre ordenamento territorial e conservação de espécies da caatinga criados e adotados pelos parceiros; nº de instrumentos de ordenamento territorial e conservação de espécies definidos e adotados pelos parceiros; nº de instituições envolvidas com a aplicação dos instrumentos com pessoal capacitado.
ACITIVITY6: nº de avaliações realizadas.

comment.narrative:
ACTIVITY1: Proteção dos biomas brasileiros: Amazônia 23%, Caatinga 6,12%, Cerrado 6,34%, Mata Atlântica 6,80%, Pantanal 2,22%, Pampa 2,68%, Zona Costeira e Marinha 1,89%, 11 Mosaicos de UCs reconhecidos. 100 instituições/associações de todos os setores envolvidos em iniciativas que direta ou indiretamente, contribuem para a implementação da CDB; áreas prioritárias para a conservação da biodiversidade atualizadas em 2006; estudos sobre 20 estoques pesqueiros sobreexplorados realizados como base para elaboração dos planos de gestão.
ACTIVITY2: Plataforma Nacional de Recursos Genéticos, composta por quatro grandes redes: Rede de Plantas, Rede de Animais, Rede de Microorganismos e Integração das Redes de Recursos Genéticos; Bancos ativos de gemoplasma com mais de 170.000 acessos para cereais: espécies forrageiras, plantas medicinais, plantas ornamentais, espécies florestais, fruteiras, palmeiras, espécies industriais, raízes e tubérculos; 7 parentes silvestres e variedades crioulas mapeadas (arroz, amendoim, algodão, abóbora, mandioca, milho e pupunha); 600 espécies da flora brasileira identificadas como plantas de valor econômico atual ou potencial; Estratégia nacional para o controle de espécies invasoras; Diagnósticos de espécies invasoras potenciais e atuais; Lei nº 11.105/2005 que estabelece normas de segurança e mecanismos de fiscalização de atividades que envolvam organismos geneticamente modificados (OGMs).
ACTIVITY3: Áreas prioritárias para conservação da biodiversidade, incluindo áreas prioritárias para a conservação de zonas úmidas; Relatório Nacional - a linha de base dos demais produtos estará definida no próximo relatório nacional para a COP11 (2012), que será entregue no 2º semestre de 2011.
ACTIVITY4: Sistema de Gestão Ambiental (SGA) em processo de implantação; Insuficiente conhecimento técnico para embasar a participação e envolvimento na CCAMLR (Convenção para Conservação dos Recursos Marinhos Vivos Antárticos); Plano de Gerenciamento da ASMA # 1

Ao longo de 2016, algumas reuniões foram feitas com novas equipes gestoras no MMA, com o objetivo de fortalecer a parceria e verificar interesse na prorrogação do projeto. Equipe ficou de avaliar módulos ainda utilizados pelo ministério.

1- Assistência técnica para o fortalecimento do Centro de Gestão do Secretário Executivo; 2- Implementação de 2 Centros de Gestão em 2 Secretarias do MMA; 3- Vinculação do Sistema de Metas com o Planejamento Estratégico; 4- Desenvolvimentos informáticos vinculados às necessidades da assistência técnica e a implementação dos centros de gestão nas secretarias selecionadas.
Não houve demanda para continuidade da implementação do SIGOB no MMA, mas outras iniciativas foram conduzidas ao longo do ano com o objetivo de fortalecer o SIGOB.

title.narrative: BRA/11/021- PROGRAM FOR ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES PAYMENT

description.narrative: The objective os this project is to combine the eradication of extreme poverty with enviromental conservation through PES Program
The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Number of new partnership mechanisms with funding for sustainable management solutions of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste at national and/or sub-national level
Number of additional males benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Number of additional females benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Total number of additional people benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Number of men above 15 years of age who acquired new jobs through a UNDP-supported project on NRM, ecosystems services, chemicals and waste
Number of women above 15 years of age who acquired new jobs through a UNDP-supported project on NRM, ecosystems services, chemicals and waste
Total number of people above 15 years of age who acquired new jobs through a UNDP-supported project on NRM, ecosystems services, chemicals and waste

The Project will be achieved by:strategy application of economic instruments that green development defined; PES monitoring program; PES inclusion strategy on sustainable production; efficient management of project
independent political entity
Energy - policy, planning and administration

Metodologia de monitoramento do Programa Nacional de Pagamento por Serviços Ambientais (PSA) desenvolvida e implantada. Dados de monitoramento do PSA sistematizados. Estratégia de inclusão produtiva sustentável no PSA desenvolvida.

comment.narrative: Em 2011 o Programa Nacional de Pagamento por Serviços Ambientais (PAS) foi criado com fins ambientais e sociais, visando aliar erradicação da extrema pobreza com conservação ambiental. Há carência de informações sobre os beneficiários, áreas de abrangência e especialmente sobre seus impactos e resultados, além disso os dados já disponíveis encontram-se armazenados de maneira rudimentar.

Aprofundamento de ações voltadas à inclusão produtiva das famílias beneficiárias do Programa, garantir a continuidade, consolidação e aperfeiçoamento do Programa de Apoio à Conservação Ambiental – “Bolsa Verde”, das Unidades de Conservação e outras unidades territoriais onde residem os beneficiários do Programa e ao desenvolvimento econômico com sustentabilidade ambiental destes territórios e das comunidades nele residentes.

Ao longo do ano de 2016 o Projeto direcionou esforços na construção de articulações e elaboração de termos de referência e realização de processos seletivos e licitatórios para contratações que resultariam em significativo avanço em sua execução em 2017.

comment.narrative: 1) 793,131 hectares under sustainable management in the Cerrado and 6,664 ha in the Caatinga; 2) 558 hectares of Caatinga ecosystem being restored, equivalent to 29,340 tCO2e sequestered and 612,6 hectares of Cerrado ecosystem being restored, equivalent to 42,493 tCO2e sequestered. 3.a) 2,735 hectares in which communities apply innovative soil management techniques; and 3.b) 4,485 hectares with improved ecosystem services as a result of community adoption of innovative water management techniques.

1) 887,335 hectares (in addition to the baseline level) under sustainable management in the Cerrado, surpassing the target by 295% and 33,317 hectares sustainably managed in the Caatinga. 2) 558 hectares of Caatinga ecosystem have been restored through a wide array of techniques such as seedlings planting, direct seed planting and natural regeneration, equivalent to 29,340 tCO2e sequestered and 612,6 hectares of Cerrado ecosystem have been restored through a wide array of techniques such as seedlings planting, direct seed planting and natural regeneration, equivalent to 42,493 tCO2e sequestered. 3.a) An additional 2,751 hectares compared to the baseline in which communities apply innovative soil management techniques: 1,754 hectares in the Cerrado and 997 hectares in the Caatinga. 3.b) 4,625 hectares (in addition to the baseline) with improved ecosystem services as a result of communities' adoption of innovative water management techniques, surpassing the target by 231%.

7 recommendations and inputs to policy process
ISPN and indigenous grantees are contributing to the improvement of the National Policy for Indigenous Territory Management PNGATI within FUNAI PPPECOS is being used as a delivery mechanism for the grants component of the GEFGATI Project
Three grantees are closely linked in order to increase local traditional communities network quilombolas geraizeiros fundo and fecho de pasto that is struggling for territory guarantee in West of Bahia against monoculture expansion and land grabbing
Based on our SGP experiences ISPN has a seat on the Federal District Council for Food Security CONSEADF and coordinates the Agroecology Committee The main influence in this period was a letter to the governor establishing guidelines for governmental action regarding agroecology One of the achievements is the implementation of an innovative agroecological technical assistance in the Federal District
Based on our SGP experiences ISPN has a seat on the National Council for Sustainable Rural Development CONDRAF which influenced for the inclusion of the wild collection on the National Government Multiannual Budget Our participation in CONDRAF is contributing to a formal request for the National Government to hire technical assistance specially focused on the Cerrado biome
In partnership with ICRAF Embrapa Cenargen Embrapa Genetic Resources Biotechnology Brazilian Agricultural Research Corporation and IUCN the workshop Conservation through Agroforestry paths for restoration among family farmers were held in May 2015 The objective was to produce inputs for the new Forest Code regulation in Brazilian states regarding oportunities and requirements for restoration by small farmers One of the results of the workshop was an Open Letter that will be sent to key Brazilian policymaking agencies stating that agroforestry systems are strategic for reconciling conservation with livelihoods and that research education and extension services need to be more geared towards familybased farming and agroforestry systems

description.narrative: BRA/13/014 “Sistema Brasileiro de Promoção Comercial e Investimentos” (SBPCI) Este projeto tem como objetivo a ampliação da coordenação entre agentes de promoção comercial e investimentos no âmbito do Governo Federal e apoio ao empresariado brasileiro
Este projeto tem como objetivo a ampliação da coordenação entre agentes de promoção comercial e investimentos no âmbito do Governo Federal e apoio ao empresariado brasileiro
independent political entity

1 - Quantidade de Organismos que aderiram ao SBPCI 2 - Sistema de acompanhamento de metas estratégicas desenvolvido. 3 - Elaboração de Guia de Internacionalização. 4 - Número de estudos produzidos 5 - Número de treinamentos realizados

comment.narrative: 1 - Falta de sinergias entre os órgãos do Sistema Brasileiro de Promoção Comercial e Investimentos; 2 - Má divulgação do produto turístico brasileiro nos mercados emergentes. 3 - Necessidade de apoio à internacionalização de empresas brasileiras. 4 - Necessidade de ampliação e aprofundamento de conteúdos na área de inteligência comercial. 5 - Não existência do modelo de gestão do DPR.

2.1.1. Elaborar estudos para identificação de informações relevantes em matéria de inteligência e informação nos mercados emissores de turistas, com base em modelos de estudos criados pela DOC que auxiliarão na confecção de subsídios a serem utilizados pela SERE. 3.1.3. Realizar cursos de capacitação e treinamento com base no "Guia Legal do Investidor Estrangeiro no Brasil" e no novo guia "How to invest in Brazil" para atração de investimentos.

Elaborado guia em inglês, contendo informações úteis para potenciais investidores estrangeiros, dividido da seguinte forma: "Welcome to foreign investors", "10 key reasons to invest in Brazil, " " Getting to know Brazil", "Business opportunities in Brazil", "Government and regulatory framework", " Most frequenty Questions.

1.1.3. Prospectar ações de cada órgão do Sistema Brasileiro de Promoção Comercial e Investimentos, verificando sinergias, interesses comuns, possibilidades de colaboração e otimização de recursos. 2.2.1. Desenvolver estudos para identificar ações eficientes de promoção do destino turístico brasileiro, em função das especificidades dos mercados emergentes emissores de turistas. 2.2.2. Definir estratégia de tradução e impressão de material de divulgação já existente de destinos turísticos próximos às grandes cidades e de atrações turísticas brasileiras de ampla repercussão no exterior. 2.4.1. Estabelecer estratégias de atração de investimentos estrangeiros na área de infraestrutura turística brasileira em parceria com o Departamento de Financiamento e Promoção de Investimentos no Turismo do MTur. 3.1.2. Definir conteúdo para programa de divulgação de oportunidades de investimento no Brasil. 6.1.1 Realizar mapeamento de projetos de cooperação técnica prestada em execução e previstos que tenham possibilidades de convergência com o SBPCI. (nova)

1.1.3 - Elaborado Programa de Feiras e Exposições do Brasil no Exterior e proposta de divulgação e publicidade do Programa de Feiras e Exposições; 2.2.1 - Elaborado 10 relatórios dos 10 principais países emissores de turistas ao Brasil e elaborado 10 relatórios dos 10 principais países emergentes que concorrem com o Brasil na recepção de turistas;
1 - Elaborar estudos de inteligência comercial 2 - Elaborar planejamento estratégico do DPR/DPG relacionado diretamente ao BRA

comment.narrative:
Todas as ações da SNPDCA estão em consonância com a normativa e as políticas existentes, mas há disposições legais recentes (a exemplo de algumas constantes da Lei do SINASE) ainda não implementadas, cuja concretização demanda empenho por parte da SDH/PR. Também há ações previstas em planos e políticas já existentes, bem como no Terceiro Programa Nacional de Direitos Humanos (PNDH-3), que ainda não foram executadas.
O Cadastro Nacional de Crianças e Adolescentes Desaparecidos já está operando (há mais de 300 cadastros registrados), embora ainda não estejam ativas todas as funcionalidades previstas e haja perspectiva de alterações relativas à sua gestão e operação.
As Escolas de Conselho e as Escolas do SINASE já capacitam algumas dezenas de pessoas por ano, mas ainda não foram universalizadas.
Já há políticas e planos nacionais nas áreas de Convivência Familiar e Comunitária e Enfrentamento da Violência Sexual contra Crianças e Adolescentes.
Há campanhas exitosas, como a do Dia 18 de Maio (contra a exploração sexual de crianças e adolescentes) e a campanha “Não desvie o olhar”.

Serviços e programas de referência em, pelo menos, 20 unidades federadas e Municípios estratégicos, implantados. Versões dos novos cadastros e ambientes virtuais lançados. Escolas Nacionais de Socioeducação e de Formação para Conselheiros implementadas em todas as unidades federadas. Apoio a 100% dos Municípios e Estados que requisitem assistência na implementação das diretrizes nacionais, bem como divulgação destas diretrizes em todas as unidades da federação. Ações divulgadas, de forma interdisciplinar e intersetorial. Parceria estabelecida sobre a aplicabilidade do fortalecimento do Sistema de Garantia de Direitos na proteção integral de crianças e adolescentes. Proposta de divulgação e estabelecimento de indicadores sociais para cada ação pactuada com a sociedade civil. Avaliação final do projeto realizada.
Cartas acordos com UNOPS e Flacso em andamento. Plano de trabalho anual elaborado.
Analisar e avaliar os projetos arquitetônicos e das obras em andamento aos Estados e Municípios.

Assinado Termo Aditivo 4 de Carta Acordo com UNOPS com o intuito de fortalecer a capacidade da SNDCA para ampliar as estruturas relacionadas ao sistema de atendimento socioeducativo em regime de semiliberdade, bem como assessorar para que o monitoramento da construção e adequação das estruturas possa assegurar a qualificação dos espaços oferecidos pelo sistema nacional em geral.

independent political entity

1- Seis (6) Documentos de Projetos elaborados, articulando dispositivos e eixos político-metodológicos para direcionar intervenções e a inclusão, nas Redes de Atenção à Saúde, dos 5 grupos populacionais que compõem os públicos-alvo do DAPES: Mulher, Criança, Índios, População Privada de Liberdade, Pessoas com Deficiência e Reabilitação.
2- Cinco mil (5.000) profissionais formados a partir de projetos de oficinas e cursos, incluindo apoiadores institucionais, equipes técnicas e gestores, para intervenção junto a populações estratégicas e/ou em situação de vulnerabilidade.
3- Uma série de material didático desenvolvida (em meio material e eletrônico), com cerca de vinte publicações produzidas e disseminadas para as instâncias formuladoras/executoras de políticas voltadas para populações estratégicas e/ou em situação de vulnerabilidade.
4- Seis (6) arranjos técnológicos-comunicacionais desenvolvidos na interface com a Rede Social "RHS/Rede HumanizaSUS", com foco na inclusão de populações estratégicas e/ou em situação de vulnerabilidade.
5- Trinta (30) Projetos de ambiência formulados para adequação física de serviços de atendimento aos grupos populacionais contemplados nos projetos de inclusão e integração nas Redes de Atenção à Saúde do SUS.

description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Number of new development partnerships with funding for improved energy efficiency and/or sustainable energy solutions targeting underserved communities/groups and women
total number of people with improved access to energy as a result of UNDP-supported intervention
Strengthening SLM governance frameworks to combat land degradation processes in Sergipe ASDs in NE Brazil.
first-order administrative division
Energy - power generation

Deforested land is used for crops and pasture in both large and small properties, including Sergipe’s agrarian reform settlements.There are 95 land reform settlements in the seven municipalities in the SAS occupying 995 km2, and corresponding to 20.3% of the total area of these municipalities. Over exploitation of wood.39. Wood harvesting is ubiquitous in the entire Northeast region. One third of the energy matrix is firewood, with 25 million m3 per year. Firewood is used by 70% of families for cooking. The extraction of 25 million m3 of wood to provide energy for industries such as gypsum and ceramics production and for commercial and residential purposes, feeding 40% of the energy matrix of the region, has caused negative impacts, although it could be sustainable.

comment.narrative: The complex policy, social and economic factors of the country still foster biodiversity loss, even with the environmental legal framework enforced and the public policies promoting biodiversity sustainable use. The Brazilian biological richness is threatened by biodiversity loss driven mainly by habitat destruction that has resulted in significant loss of forest cover and ensuing biodiversity losses. Specifically, widespread agricultural expansion (including forestry and conversion to pastures, and small-scale agriculture) is the most significant driver of plant population extinction and degradation.

1 virtual + 2 face-to-face meetings per year attended;
2 working papers produced;

The “Brazil-Africa Social Protection Community” http://socialprotection.org/connect/communities/brazil-africa-social-protection-community was created and currently there are 70 participants - policy makers from Brazil and African countries. In total, 17 African LICs countries are being targeted (Madagascar, Niger, Nigeria, Angola, Cape Verde, Senegal, Zambia, Ivory Coast, Liberia, Burkina Faso, Mauritania, Kenia, Uganda, Zimbabwe, Mali, Sierra Leone, Benin, Rwanda and Ghana).
ONLINE DISCUSSIONS: Two Online Discussions regarding on how to overcome Social Protection challenges were carried out on the “Brazil-Africa Social Protection Community” http://socialprotection.org/connect/communities/brazil-africa-social-protection-community The third Online Discussion on gender-sensitive social protection policies “Brazil – Africa: The Gender Aspects of Social Protection” will starts this week.
VIRTUAL MEETING: The Virtual Meeting "Brazil - Africa: The Gender aspects of Social Protection" was held last week (June, 09) with the participation of policy makers from Brazil and African countries.
FACE TO FACE MEETINGS: IPC-IG supported two events in Africa, involving policy makers from African countries in order to discuss how to overcome challenges faced during the design and implementation of this social policies. Both meetings were carried out under the CoP (Communities of Practices) initiative also supported by the World Bank and UNICEF. The CoP Anglophone meeting was in Arusha, Tanzania; and the CoP Francophone meeting was in Brazzaville, Congo. Both in May.
. So far, IPC-IG has produced 09 research studies, all of them are oriented to improve public policies. Below a list of these publications with links.
ONLINE BOOK: “Social Protection in Africa: inventory of non-contributory programmes” http://www.ipc-undp.org/publication/27902
WORKING PAPER #143 “Brazil–Africa knowledge-sharing on Social Protection and food and nutrition security” - English: http://www.ipc-und

CSW60 Side Event "Achieving Women's Empowerment and Gender Equality whithin the 2030 Agenda: The Role of Innovative Development Partnerships Between Country Governments and UN Agencies was held on March 16, 2016 in NYC. Organizers: Government of Brazil, Government of the United Kingdom; UN-Women and UNFPA. Objectives: (i) Share country’s perspectives on the progress in implementing CSW agreed conclusions for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of women and ideas on different/non-traditional ways to work in partnership for the implementation of the CSW’s Multi-Year Programme of Work, including through South-South / Triangular and multilateral cooperation, joint high-level policy dialogues and peer learning; (ii) Explore what should be done differently, through South-South/Trilateral and multilateral cooperation, to achieve the ambitious targets set out by the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, especially under the Global Goal 5 (Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls).
Publication and Launch of the Booklet “Progress of the World’s Women: Transforming Economies, Realizing Rights" on May 9, 2016.

Ano 2 (semestre 1)estratégia de disseminação/comunicação desenvolvida; metodologia de implantação de sistema de alerta rápido sobre novas drogas desenvolvida (semestre 2) acompanhamento e avaliação da implantação do plano estratégico do novo OBID realizada; estratégia de alerta rápido sobre novas drogas implantada no contexto do OBID
Ano 2 (semestre 1) estratégia de acompanhamento à implantação da metodologia de avaliação e de ações de qualificação da CT desenvolvida; 5 oficinas para disseminação e formação para implantação da metodologia da avaliação realizada; (semestre 2) monitoramento da implantação da metodologia de avaliação e de ações de qualificação das CT realizado; mapeamento e sistematização de boas práticas nacionais em comunidades terapêuticas, de acordo com novas diretrizes, realizado e disseminado; edição com publicação de boas práticas selecionadas realizada

De acordo com o relatório de progresso do ano de 2017, o projeto teve "baixíssima execução físico-financeira do Projeto, uma vez que sua assinatura ocorreu em 31/12/2015, ou seja, durante todo o ano de 2016 permaneceu inerte".

title.narrative: BRA/15/010 - Fortalecimento e Expansão do SINAPIR

description.narrative: Este Projeto tem como objetivo potencializar a implementação do Sistema Nacional de Promoção da Igualdade Racial (SINAPIR), a partir do fortalecimento dos arranjos institucionais previstos no sistema e da ampliação da participação federativa.

Este Projeto tem como objetivo potencializar a implementação do Sistema Nacional de Promoção da Igualdade Racial (SINAPIR), a partir do fortalecimento dos arranjos institucionais previstos no sistema e da ampliação da participação federativa.
independent political entity
Health - policy, planning and administration

comment.narrative: PRODUTO 1- - Os NEABs são estruturas, em geral, carentes de recursos financeiros para a execução de atividades de pesquisa e extensão. PRODUTO 2- Os NEABs são estruturas potencialmente relevantes para o desenvolvimento de pesquisas de avaliação e monitoramento das políticas de ações afirmativas no ambiente educacional, mas necessitam de apoio externo para tal; PRODUTO 3- - As propostas de convênio solicitam recursos financeiros predominantemente para aquisição de bens duráveis. Das 35 propostas classificadas na Chamada Pública nº 01/2015 – 32% são para ações em custeio e 68% para investimento. - Os Estados e Municípios têm dificuldade de apresentar projetos nos moldes do Portal dos Convênios, principalmente pela exigência do valor mínimo de R$ 100 mil, dado que muitos projetos, especialmente os de custeio, necessitam de um aporte financeiro com um valor menor que o exigido. - Além disso, pelas características citadas, não existe a expertise de projetos de custeio para o fortalecimento institucional das políticas de promoção da igualdade racial, no âmbito de seus órgãos e conselhos. PRODUTO 4- A SEPPIR/PR em maio de 2015 realizou um levantamento que constatou a existência de 196 Órgãos e 105 Conselhos voltados à promoção da igualdade racial. O SINAPIR possui 32 participantes em outubro de 2015. PRODUTO 5- Projeto BRA/15/010 elaborado.

1. Levantamento das atividades dos NEABs e produção de relatório com as informações consolidadas 2. Seleção de projetos apresentados pelos NEABs com propostas de desenvolvimento de pesquisa e atividades de extensão na temática racial. 3.1 Lançamento de TOR para elaboração de modelos de Termos de Referência para projetos de custeio, de acordo com conteúdo programático e temático abordado pela SEPPIR, no âmbito do programa para o desenvolvimento do SINAPIR, através do fortalecimento dos órgãos e conselhos voltados à promoção da igualdade racial, com a contratação de consultoria especializada nesta produção. 4. Orientar a criação, desenvolvimento e planejamento de órgãos e conselhos voltados à promoção da igualdade racial no âmbito do SINAPIR. (i) um guia/manual de criação, desenvolvimento e planejamento de órgão de promoção da igualdade racial, contemplando a elaboração de um plano de promoção da igualdade racial e enfrentamento ao racismo; (ii) um guia/manual de criação, desenvolvimento e planejamento de conselho voltado para a promoção da igualdade racial. Os documentos deverão se aplicar à realidade de Estados, Municípios e Consórcios Públicos.
Em virtude da transição do Governo, o projeto não teve execução em 2016. Várias reuniões foram realizadas, 3 TORs foram escritos mas não foram lançados.

1. Levantamento das atividades dos NEABs e produção de relatório com as informações consolidadas. 2. Seleção de projetos apresentados pelos NEABs com propostas de desenvolvimento de pesquisa e atividades de extensão na temática racial. 3.1 Lançamento de TOR para elaboração de modelos de Termos de Referência para projetos de custeio, de acordo com conteúdo programático e temático abordado pela SEPPIR, no âmbito do programa para o desenvolvimento do SINAPIR, através do fortalecimento dos órgãos e conselhos voltados à promoção da igualdade racial, com a contratação de consultoria especializada nesta produção. 4. Orientar a criação, desenvolvimento e planejamento de órgãos e conselhos voltados à promoção da igualdade racial no âmbito do SINAPIR. (i) um guia/manual de criação, desenvolvimento e planejamento de órgão de promoção da igualdade racial, contemplando a elaboração de um plano de promoção da igualdade racial e enfrentamento ao racismo; (ii) um guia/manual de criação, desenvolvimento e planejamento de conselho voltado para a promoção da igualdade racial. Os documentos deverão se aplicar à realidade de Estados, Municípios e Consórcios Públicos.

Ao longo de 2017, foram realizadas três contratações dentro do projeto que resultaram no alcance das seguintes metas:
1. Elaboração de relatório com o mapeamento dos NEABs no Brasil, com entrega prevista para início de 2018. Com isso, será possível realizar a seleção de aproximadamente 25 projetos de NEABs por meio de edital de Chamada Pública;
2. Elaboração de modelos de Termos de Referência para projetos de custeio, no âmbito do programa para o desenvolvimento do SINAPIR, através do fortalecimento dos órgãos e conselhos voltados à promoção da igualdade racial: os termos de referência serão utilizados neste projeto e também para futuros editais de transferência voluntárias da SEPPIR.
3. Documentos para orientar a criação, desenvolvimento e planejamento de órgãos e conselhos voltados à promoção da igualdade racial no âmbito do SINAPIR: os guias para orientação à criação de Órgãos e Conselhos farão parte da publicação de divulgação do SINAPIR, o que ocorrerá de forma permanente à existência deste sistema. O produto passará a ser uma referência bibliográfica aos Entes Federados para o desenvolvimento de suas estruturas administrativas.

description.narrative: Support to Technical and Vocational Education and Training in Haiti through the Establishment of a Vocational Training Center and Related Institutional Strengthening.
independent political entity
% infrastrucutre constructed % of equipment installed Number of students trained Number of occupations or technology areas offered by vocational Training center

comment.narrative: A significant part of the infrastructure for education, both public and private, was destroyed or damaged, and many teachers lost their lives, as did staff from the Ministry of National Education and Professional Training after the earthquake.

The funds of this project was transferred to UNDP Brazil only October 7th, 2016 but accounted only on November 3rd, 2016. The major issue that prevents project execution isi the electoral process in Haiti.

During 2016, the project was elaborated, approved, launched, set up implementation arrangements between UNDP Brazil and UNDP Haiti resulting in an Agreement, and established and LoA with SENAI.
In 9th November, 2016 the project was officially launched with the presence of the Minister of Foreign Affairs/MRE of Brazil, the Director of the Brazilian Cooperation Agency/ABC, the President of the National Industry Confederation of Brazil, the Director of the National Industrial Learning Service, the Resident Coordinator of the United Nations in Brazil and the Resident Representative of UNDP in Brazil, the Secretary of Vocational Training in Haiti, the ambassador of Haiti in Brazil, and the Director of the Vocational Training National Institute of Haiti.

Technical Note for the selection of land to the Brazilian and Haitian Professional Training Center prepared. % of progress of the work of the Vocational Training Center. % of progress of equipment installed on the Vocational Training Center.

There is not physical progress under this project, because of the demands of the GoH does not attend the counterparts of this project (SENAI, ABC). During the current year was made 03 missions: 01 from BSB to PAP in MayJune; 01 from PAP to BSB and POA in July and 01 from PAP to BSB in October. Agreed in October during the Haitian mission in BSB the adjustment to this project to build 03 VTC instead of 01, project support logistics to the Haitian INFP staff according to the Aid Memoire attached.
- promover ações de cooperação sul-sul com o Haiti na área de formação profissional, por meio da contratação obras de 3 Centro de Formação Profissional.

comment.narrative: Considering Nike’s commitment to creating positive change through the power of sports and physical activity to unleash human potential, and the engagement of UNDP Brazil in mobilizing public, private and civil society organizations to promote cross-sectorial solutions to foster the integration of physical activity into the people’s daily lives, the Project was created with 2 specific objectives: • Production and dissemination of materials and tools containing recommendations for early positive experiences with sports and physical activity; and • Mapping of strategic opportunities within the Brazilian public, private and civil society sectors in the field of sports and physical activity to identify potential gaps for partnerships and investments.

Production and dissemination of materials and tools containing recommendations for early positive experiences with sports and physical activity; and Mapping of strategic opportunities within the Brazilian public, private and civil society sectors in the field of sports and physical activity to identify potential gaps for partnerships and investments.

A primeira meta foi atendida. A segunda foi excluída do escopo do projeto e substituída pelo apoio da Nike ao lançamento do RDHNacional sobre esporte e pelo lançamento do site com a sistematizaçao da experiencia das escolas e comunidades ativas
- encerrar as atividades do projeto.
